Like I said earlier, will be incredibly difficult to convince me to watch the remaining episodes of this anime but everyone should at least give the first 6 episodes a watch.', 'It\'s a yuri journey of duty-bound executioner, and a time-travelling yandere executee.Hence it\'s super different from normal isekai because All Summonees Must Die.I don\'t get why are people so smitten with this show. It\'s twelve episodes of messed up relationship, from both sides. I care fuck all about "world-building" and "plot" if 70% if not more of the story is 2 people faking smiles and lying to each other in some twisted bout of duty.If I wanted this kind of slop I\'d give Citrus a swing instead of watching the isekai version.Then again, all poor weaboos with isekai bleeding out of all the orifices in...their head might enjoy this because it certainly does not copy the common isekai mould. For better or for worse. their head might enjoy this because it certainly does not copy the common isekai mould. For better or for worse.', 'is it worth watching? i just finished episode 6 and am left totaly unwiling to watch anymore further. all that is left is a cold blooded murderer that is delusional thinking that they can save the world by killing innocent people and 2 people totaly obsesively in love with that murderer for no apparent reason, they would even gladly destroy the world for that lover, that is a cold blooded murderer. And a princess thats also a powerhouse but fights just for the fun of it, altho she did at least try and figure out what happend, so basicaly only the princes for me...is kinda ok cuz she is seeking the truth without being moraly completely bankrupt. 3 totaly unlikable chars and 1 ok side char. pls let me know, cuz if it stays this way i really dont care about any of them, well maybe the princess is ok. Even Overload at least did sell pure evil well. let me know if any of the 3 chars will get a councious in the 7th episode else i just pass. oh and manipulating time + manipulating memories ? really ? is kinda ok cuz she is seeking the truth without being moraly completely bankrupt. 3 totaly unlikable chars and 1 ok side char. pls let me know, cuz if it stays this way i really dont care about any of them, well maybe the princess is ok. Even Overload at least did sell pure evil well. let me know if any of the 3 chars will get a councious in the 7th episode else i just pass. oh and manipulating time + manipulating memories ? really ?', "Not worth the time, it's a bland story with unlikable characters. The main ones are so boring and it's hard to even try to stay interested or even not outright despise them. Story could have been a decent twist but it's just falls flat from the start. Can't recommend to anyone that I didn't want to torture by wasting their time. I don't think you can really classify this as isekai really? Besides the MC's victims. Art is bad too. Reactions to this show are really hot or miss, not sure how anyone could stomach this seriously. How many more words do I need? I'm...not really sure so I'm adding this onto it. Pass. not really sure so I'm adding this onto it. Pass.", "A fantastic premise,fairly good animation from J.C staff also a great bit of lore and world building woven into the story.Yet it misses badly.I might blame the pacing which is at times furious at first and slows down terribly at the midpoint.The story has enough twists and bends to make it exciting.Yet the whole presentation has less charisma than your run of the mill seasonal villaness isekai.I found few of the characters likeable and the villains less so.(Give a witty nutcase villain or cool badass anyday than what we get from this bunch.)If you're an Isekai fan on 1000th journey to defeat a demon Lord...and just want something/anything different give it a shot.Otherwise I'd say toss it. and just want something/anything different give it a shot.Otherwise I'd say toss it.", 'I honestly cannot comprehend how this one has such a low score? I mean, did we watch the same anime? Yeah, it is not an Eva, but this is one of the most interesting isekai out there, I can barely name a few which can compete with this one. I\'m baffled.What you get here:-Amazing and unique soft magic system. Actually, this is one of the most interesting one what I have ever seen in isekai (and I\'m an isekai trash). True, you doesn\'t get to know exact levels and stats (since probably there is no such thing here), but I do firmly belive these type...of magic systems works much better in the long run, since you doesn\'t have to intruduce more and more OP enemies once the protagonist got the powerup.-Lively unique world, which is an interesting mashup of early industrial age, magic, and modern technology. It actually feels like living, breathing real world with an actual history. (it has amazing potential)-Neat story with interesting character development-Interesting characters with actual personality (Momo maybe questionable, but fine), and the majority of them are female characters who don\'t exist just to make the main character look like a chad (especially since the mc is a girl) This is not a "collect your next pokemon into your harem" type of isekai.-Real moral dilemmas and meaningful inner turmoil-Really good fight scenes with beautiful visuals (note though, that there was 2 or 3 fight scenes where the CG felt really off, I don\'t know why, because most of the time this was an eyecandy for me)-Xenofobia, understandably-Light gore with occational mildly grusesome scenes. So the anime has a bit darker tone, but nothing really shockingWhat you doesn\'t get:-OP self insert protagonist-The pinnacle of all isekai is missing, the almighy harem (thank god for that)-Probably you\'ll not get a second season. It seems like there is only demand for Kirito clones in the anime community, and the outrage over the 100th same tasteless isekai is just for show. Don\'t get me wrong I love the OP edgy protagonists too, but sometimes I like a bit of variety. So I really hope I\'m wrong.Summary: Highly recommended. of magic systems works much better in the long run, since you doesn\'t have to intruduce more and more OP enemies once the protagonist got the powerup.-Lively unique world, which is an interesting mashup of early industrial age, magic, and modern technology. It actually feels like living, breathing real world with an actual history. (it has amazing potential)-Neat story with interesting character development-Interesting characters with actual personality (Momo maybe questionable, but fine), and the majority of them are female characters who don\'t exist just to make the main character look like a chad (especially since the mc is a girl) This is not a "collect your next pokemon into your harem" type of isekai.-Real moral dilemmas and meaningful inner turmoil-Really good fight scenes with beautiful visuals (note though, that there was 2 or 3 fight scenes where the CG felt really off, I don\'t know why, because most of the time this was an eyecandy for me)-Xenofobia, understandably-Light gore with occational mildly grusesome scenes. Don\'t get me wrong I love the OP edgy protagonists too, but sometimes I like a bit of variety. So I really hope I\'m wrong.Summary: Highly recommended.', 'To be concise (who reads full reviews anyways), I think this is an enjoyable show with a relatively weak plot made up for by constant high octane action which keeps the show from getting boring, which in my opinion is extremely commendable. Don\'t watch expecting some profound drama or heartrending emotion you might get from similar shows like Re:Zero but know you\'re still in for an entertaining ride.The fact this show is below a 7 frankly makes no sense and the fact literal trash like Black Summoner has a substantially higher score makes me question the rating system on this site, don\'t be scared...by the below 7 rating and just enjoy this experience I would describe as "good entertainment".PS: I agree the over-affectionate relationships are a bit much, but to say it detracts enough to deserve below a 7 is absurd, the show is simply "good" and deserves a mid-low 7. by the below 7 rating and just enjoy this experience I would describe as "good entertainment".PS: I agree the over-affectionate relationships are a bit much, but to say it detracts enough to deserve below a 7 is absurd, the show is simply "good" and deserves a mid-low 7.', 'This anime was pretty enjoyable, but it has a ton of flaws. My biggest flaw is how most of the plot is structured over Menou and Akari.I like Menou a lot as a character and the backstory is pretty cool and super enjoyable. I like seeing how other Wolders changed the world too and how she feels guilty and relieved with her job as an executioner. I also liked how they showed the other students at the training session for being a priestess/executioner. And the other options Menou could have taken. I like her and Momo (in the beginning I didn\'t like Momo but...seeing the backstory that wasn\'t too informative, but made me feel something about Momo and Memou, I just wish there was more)I don\'t like how she keeps using Momo for other jobs that don\'t involve Akari. true there isn\'t a real way to get Momo involved (yet) but it\'s still sad seeing her only asking Momo for help and not hanging out with her. If we had a few chill episodes maybe I\'d feel attached to the characters more.Now let\'s talk Akari. I hate her. true there\'s a reason why she\'s so annoying, obnoxious, and over affectionate, but it still doesn\'t change how a friendship works. I wish we got to see them warming up more, but Akari pushes straight through the boundaries. I don\'t know how Akaris past life in Japan was, but it\'s still very weird that Shes so affectionate. Which is better than just having a normal friendship right? If you\'re looking for something different than this is the anime, if not than you probably won\'t like it. Akari annoyed me, but she was just trying to make memories with her new friend. I wish she had other motives than just helping my friend and getting out of this world thanks to her. She literally feels like a harem character. With her and Momo.Let\'s talk about Akaris future self. I kind of like her way more than the annoying Newly transported Akari, but still, What the fuck. the plot is completely centered around Akari and Menou so they can\'t explain why Akari really loves Menou (which she actually does) which just makes this feel awkward. She just plainly loves Menou. It feels weird and unsatisfying that I don\'t know a main core of the series, but it\'s a huge part of the plot so it can\'t just be explained early on. I hope there\'s a side series or a flashback that shows Akaris first time in this world and how she experienced it. This would mainly be a sequel to that; although it would add a ton more depth, but that wouldn\'t be the way the author intended this series to be seen. It just feels weird. In terms of "returning by death" I liked Subaru way more than Akari. Future Akari doesn\'t have a certain charm I expected her to have. And I wish she would actually talk with Menou and try finding a solution that way (but I\'m sure she has before) For now she\'s just going with the flow until something goes wrong. What is she going to do if the same thing happens like the other loops? Shes just watching from afar.Which brings me to the plot. I hate how the main plot is just completely centered around Akari and Menou. It would be way better if it focused on the main scale things and showed Akari and Menous friendship slowly. This is why Momo and Ashuna\'s plot points are way more enjoyable and usually better. There\'s no useless dialogue, no over affectionate moments, no awkwardness. And guess what? We get to see them warm up to each other and care about each other. I like the side plots way more.Also, with the plots it feels like they\'re bringing out the mystery way too early. This anime had so many golden opportunities to fool the audience, but they just tell you everything an episode or 2 later. Without ever making u think hard about it.Another complaint i have is with the world building. So much has been unexplained that we don\'t really understand the powers. In a fight Menou could easily just use a whole unexplained ability or common knowledge about the ability to win and we the audience wouldn\'t know what happened or is going on.This could be farfetched, but when I watched Mushoku Tensei, or Re zero I at least had a pretty decent idea of the powers and abilities and the lore behind them. Sure, we know the lore behind the powers in this anime, but we need more of a idea. Are these powers special to Menou? Are these powers even hers? Is it her knife?What we really know is that Shes an assassin/executioner that\'s skilled with many assassin things and that magic is a huge factor.To conclude this anime was pretty enjoyable I can see why people like this, I even liked it, but it has a ton of pacing and noticeable flaws that makes it feel way worse than it probably is? Maybe the manga is better. Pacing wise the manga could have more and maybe more moments because this feels a bit rushed.I\'m pretty interested in the plot, and I love the foreshadowing of Momo trying to kill Akari for Menou, but I hope season 2 is better content wise. Maybe I\'ll watch it, maybe i wont. seeing the backstory that wasn\'t too informative, but made me feel something about Momo and Memou, I just wish there was more)I don\'t like how she keeps using Momo for other jobs that don\'t involve Akari. true there isn\'t a real way to get Momo involved (yet) but it\'s still sad seeing her only asking Momo for help and not hanging out with her. If we had a few chill episodes maybe I\'d feel attached to the characters more.Now let\'s talk Akari. I hate her. true there\'s a reason why she\'s so annoying, obnoxious, and over affectionate, but it still doesn\'t change how a friendship works. I wish we got to see them warming up more, but Akari pushes straight through the boundaries. I don\'t know how Akaris past life in Japan was, but it\'s still very weird that Shes so affectionate. Which is better than just having a normal friendship right? If you\'re looking for something different than this is the anime, if not than you probably won\'t like it. Akari annoyed me, but she was just trying to make memories with her new friend. I wish she had other motives than just helping my friend and getting out of this world thanks to her. We get to see them warm up to each other and care about each other. I like the side plots way more.Also, with the plots it feels like they\'re bringing out the mystery way too early. Sure, we know the lore behind the powers in this anime, but we need more of a idea. Are these powers special to Menou? Are these powers even hers? Is it her knife?What we really know is that Shes an assassin/executioner that\'s skilled with many assassin things and that magic is a huge factor.To conclude this anime was pretty enjoyable I can see why people like this, I even liked it, but it has a ton of pacing and noticeable flaws that makes it feel way worse than it probably is? Maybe the manga is better. Pacing wise the manga could have more and maybe more moments because this feels a bit rushed.I\'m pretty interested in the plot, and I love the foreshadowing of Momo trying to kill Akari for Menou, but I hope season 2 is better content wise. Maybe I\'ll watch it, maybe i wont.', 'I\'m a sucker for Isekai. I almost always rate isekai pretty highly. This anime was OK by isekai standards it was about average. This will be a short review about what the show does right and what it does wrong.So lets start wit the good. As with many isekai this show has an awesome concept. Instead of a super generic show about an OP protagonist having fun adventuring in a new world, it\'s about an assassin who\'se job it is to kill said OP protagonists. Awesome way to break the mold. The world is wonderful, they actually have a decent explanation for why eveeryone...speaks japanese, and eats japanese like foods. It\'s not just lazy mash up of mideval european architecture with japanese culture. The animation is pretty decent I would only have one complaint and it\'s not a bad one, the "big bad" of the first season has some decent 3D animation but it clashes with everything else up to this point.The bad. As with other isekai they took an awesome concept and threw it out the window. Instead of focusing on an assasin and their struggle to kill OP protagonists from another world. This story instead focuses on a not OP but actually secretly OP protagonist and their growing harem as they continue their adventure. Sound familiar? The difference you might ask? It\'s Yuri, you heard me right, the protagonist is a cute girl. And she likes to flaunt it all the time. She has not one, but two annoying sidekicks. One of whish she is trying to kill but secretly starts to fall in love with them, again totally not generic in the least. Basically what could have been a wonderful show falling victim to generic isekai tropes just re-skinned to make it look different enough to hopefully trick people into thinking it\'s actually not a generic copy x paste story.Brief summary TLDR: If you want an interesting world with some great worldbuilding this is it pretty good. If you want something new and entertaining, not a generic isekai then this isn\'t what you want it\'s re-skinned enough to make it watcheable, but that\'s about it. The characters try to be supper edgy and complately fail and it just ends up being Meh. It\'s worth a watch in my opinion though. speaks japanese, and eats japanese like foods. It\'s not just lazy mash up of mideval european architecture with japanese culture. The animation is pretty decent I would only have one complaint and it\'s not a bad one, the "big bad" of the first season has some decent 3D animation but it clashes with everything else up to this point.The bad. The characters try to be supper edgy and complately fail and it just ends up being Meh. It\'s worth a watch in my opinion though.', 'I am not very picky with the anime i watch. The main thing for me is the draw in. I mean I\'ll watch all 13-26 episodes of an anime if i enjoyed the first few just see how everything wraps up. So onto this animes unique introduction. the main complaint ive seen about the show is the one i have as well. i read the the synopsis and was ready to have the "main character" there for the entire show. I lost interest the moment i realized the one thing he couldnt Null lol. i hope everyone else enjoyed the anime but it would take...cosmic power to drag me back into this one because of what i consider a botched beginning cosmic power to drag me back into this one because of what i consider a botched beginning', "It's really enjoyable sometimes, but at other times I can barely watch at 2x speed.It starts off with a pretty interesting concept; an Isekai world that is used to dealing with -and killing people who get isekaied because they're too powerful. Unfortunately, the concept wears out kind of quickly and three of the characters really annoy me -Akari who is annoyingly childish, Momo who crushes way too hard on Menou, and Princess Ashuna who randomly fights people for no reason and makes things harder for Menou. The show starts to drag quite a bit at like ep 7; but ep 10 and 11 do make...up for the previous episodes being bad. Art is amazing minus the CGI monsters. Overall a fine show but it has a few really slow episodes that made me drop it midway (only returned because I heard the the new episodes were really good). up for the previous episodes being bad. Art is amazing minus the CGI monsters. Overall a fine show but it has a few really slow episodes that made me drop it midway (only returned because I heard the the new episodes were really good).", "Based on the reviews saying that past episode 10 things are pretty interesting, my thoughts about the series may be incomplete but honestly I don't think that it could fix the gripes that I have with the series.Minor spoilers coming:I actually found the bait and switch of the main character to be a refreshing concept that made this seem like it could end up being a unique and intriguing anime. However, the problem is that there was just no real satisfying journey of how the viewer is supposed to view the main character and her struggle. Is she supposed to be a sympathetic villain, a...misguided hero, etc. Yes they do explain the reasoning behind her actions, but her thoughts and personality don't really match her actions which make it a bit painful to watch and very hard to get behind. If she automatically hated people that were summoned to her world because of what had happened to her and had no sorrow over killing them it would have worked and been interesting. If she reluctantly killed people as a last resort to prevent disasters but looked for another way it also would have worked. Even if she killed without remorse but made it extremely clear when doing so that she despised whoever summons people and that they're her real target for vengeance that she'll pursue quickly and radically it might have worked.  What we're left with is just a weird in between that while closest to the third scenario, really doesn't make things clear and decisive enough which leads to absolutely no emotional attachment or sympathy for the main character.Other than the main character the plot seems reasonable and the fights are alright, there's just nothing really special about the anime that makes you keep watching. misguided hero, etc. Yes they do explain the reasoning behind her actions, but her thoughts and personality don't really match her actions which make it a bit painful to watch and very hard to get behind. If she automatically hated people that were summoned to her world because of what had happened to her and had no sorrow over killing them it would have worked and been interesting. If she reluctantly killed people as a last resort to prevent disasters but looked for another way it also would have worked. Even if she killed without remorse but made it extremely clear when doing so that she despised whoever summons people and that they're her real target for vengeance that she'll pursue quickly and radically it might have worked.  What we're left with is just a weird in between that while closest to the third scenario, really doesn't make things clear and decisive enough which leads to absolutely no emotional attachment or sympathy for the main character.Other than the main character the plot seems reasonable and the fights are alright, there's just nothing really special about the anime that makes you keep watching.", "Good concept but some of parts of the story are annoying and unbearable to watch.The concept of people who got isekaied are too much for the world is interesting.The magic system is quite good.World is interesting.Although yuri is a nice addition, it's just annoying sometimes. Specially the main isekaied girl. It's just unbearable when she is on screen. It ruins anything good about the main concept of the plot.It's like ecchi ruining a perfect moment.Everyone else's interactions were fine.All and all not worth the time, just because it has a new concept. I watched the whole thing just because I happened have all episodes...downloaded. downloaded.", 'I wrote pretty A4 with spoils and whole plot but then i told myself meeeh lets make it easy and short...Soooo....Main character is without soul or personality its just "doll" that doing what she is told no matter what which made me pretty hate her.Whole plot is about killing summoned ppl. as they are dangerous but when MC find out that tragedy what happened when she was young was caused by tests and experiments of her superior she will change nothing it has no impact on her like it would never happened.Then we have some event about idfk what it even was when we find...out that our MC2 is not what it seems and when we will see some promise of plot that gives some logic its ep12 and end.You maybe will like it and find logic in it but i dont and thats all for me... out that our MC2 is not what it seems and when we will see some promise of plot that gives some logic its ep12 and end.You maybe will like it and find logic in it but i dont and thats all for me...', 'It\'s a real shame this show took the road it did because it most certainly could have been a winner. Realistically though, it just managed to put me to sleep. It\'s pretty clear what went wrong, but it\'s less clear what the original intent was. I\'d like to state that the show does have an intriguing pilot episode, with a somewhat surprising and unsettling event that occurs that succeeded in somewhat subverting my expectations. Regardless of that, it wasn\'t enough to carry the episodes I did watch up to.To me, there is a foundation that needs to be built before you surprise the audience....This is where I go into spoiler territory so please turn away if you don\'t want to be spoiled. Continuing, the episode just kind of jumps into it where a boy is transported to a new world, like every other isekai, but, unlike every other isekai, is thrown out considering his abilities are of no use to the summoners. Long story short, he meets a girl, the protagonist of the series, that is an executioner for summoned individuals that generally pose a threat (although she\'s 2 for 2 so far, so I think she kills all of them). The episode ends abruptly with the summoned boy getting a knife to the head and the executioner\'s journey thus begins.Now this plot is pretty unique but is completely surface level. Once you get adjusted to the current state of the world there\'s not much to hold you captive. Typically the characters and their dynamic would take over to make up for a vapid storyline, but unfortunately for this series, the characters are absolute trash. There are only two characters that stood out as anything special: Momo (the Executioner Menou\'s sidekick/assistant) and Princess Ashuna. Unfortunately their roles are sidelined for the awful dialogue between Menou and her target for execution Akari.If there\'s anything you take away from my review, just know, Akari is one of the worst and superficial characters ever written in an anime. I honestly thought her character was made to be dull, stupid, and impulsive so we the audience would feel less bad about her death, which unfortunately never came during my viewing. Second worse character is none other Menou whose dialogue can be compared to a car engine idling. She drones on with a somewhat respectable ideology in the most monotonous and lethargic energy. I\'m not sure what the creators were thinking in making the main character so dull, and her "love interest" so annoying and incompetent.I\'d like to address the relationship between Menou and Akari as well. Akari is literally the most unattractive character ever made...a very ugly design, annoying personality, and no semblance of any redeemable traits (literally one of the most pointless characters I\'ve ever seen). Menou is not much better but at least has a cool design and serves at least some sort of purpose. Regardless, Akari "falls in love" with Menou just after one instance of being held in her arms as they escape the castle, which would be okay for a start to a relationship, but Akari, in her sea of stupidity, fantasizes about the potential love they could have. Menou couldn\'t be any less interested aside from Akari looking like a girl from a reoccurring dream she has. My point is there is little here to root for. And to clarify, it\'s not because it is yuri content. I actually enjoy some Yuri content, however this show falls into the same trap many other shows like it. Just because the "mold is being broken" so to speak does not excuse poor writing. If you want examples of where it\'s done well, just look to shows like Legend of Korra or Sailor Moon. Shows where a relationship is built upon a solid foundation, and where both characters carry the appeal and not just one. You can\'t throw two opposing personalities and just say opposites attract. Whats even worse is Momo exists in the series and also already loves Menou. The princess is also a very cool character, and a viable yuri alternative love interest. Why did it have to be Akari?Moving on to what I personally liked about the series, which there are quite a few elements. The animation, in my opinion, is done pretty well. The action/fight scenes along with character designs, besides Akari, are done very well. And there are additionally some very cool moments. When the summoned boy from the first episode takes a knife to the head, it was done very well! Specifically, the visual energy that forms around summoned people looks unique and intriguing. In the second episode, we see where Menou used to live get annihilated and turned to what appears to be salt, and the executioners come in to resolve the issue with their own unique abilities. In another scene, we\'re able to see just how magic can be used with infused devices during a fight scene between Momo and the Princess, where Momo\'s weapon, a chain blade, is turned into a chainsaw type sword. It\'s scenes like these where I appreciated what the show had to offer and that was only in a few episodes.There are other elements like world design, lore, and sound that I found really impressive. In these instances, the show comes off very well, however, there is too much that is done wrong in between these worthwhile moments. Specifically in the character dialogue as previously mentioned. It\'s really that dull and annoying, and was definitely enough for me to drop the series. I don\'t know if I plan to continue with it or not. Just hearing Akari and Menou interact is enough to drive the most patient individual to tears, it\'s just that terrible. Tack onto it Akari\'s horrid design and useless maneuvering along with Menou\'s one track thought process and monotonous tone, it\'s honestly not worth the effort for the few scenes characters that were done well. This is where I go into spoiler territory so please turn away if you don\'t want to be spoiled. Continuing, the episode just kind of jumps into it where a boy is transported to a new world, like every other isekai, but, unlike every other isekai, is thrown out considering his abilities are of no use to the summoners. It\'s scenes like these where I appreciated what the show had to offer and that was only in a few episodes.There are other elements like world design, lore, and sound that I found really impressive. In these instances, the show comes off very well, however, there is too much that is done wrong in between these worthwhile moments. Specifically in the character dialogue as previously mentioned. It\'s really that dull and annoying, and was definitely enough for me to drop the series. I don\'t know if I plan to continue with it or not. Just hearing Akari and Menou interact is enough to drive the most patient individual to tears, it\'s just that terrible. Tack onto it Akari\'s horrid design and useless maneuvering along with Menou\'s one track thought process and monotonous tone, it\'s honestly not worth the effort for the few scenes characters that were done well.', "A different take from the flood of isekai that has saturated the anime market, The Executioner and Her Way of Life gives us something of a view from the other side of things.Characters that have arrived in this world in standard isekai fashion are extremely powerful, but have a history of changing too much of the world are feared and seen as a problem to be controlled. The main character through this anime is dealing with the realities of her work as well as trying to develop as a person herself. There were several points where I thought I knew where the story was going...only for it to be derailed rather suddenly.The story as a whole is a pretty slow burn, the few focus characters are revealed over the course of the show, rather than all at once and it's a nice change from the info dump episodes I'm used to getting these days. However, with there only being one season and the story not being fully told, we do not get a real conclusion or full picture on anything. This is could be taken as a blessing or a curse for the show, depending on the viewer. Personally, I like when a show doesn't give me everything and I feel instead like I'm just viewing a fragment of a character's life, but I know that is not a style for everyone.The tropes that are assigned to the supporting cast are really why this isn't a 10/10 show to me. There is a hard lean into obsession over the main character that at no point feels natural nor necessary. One character that isn't fawning over the MC is instead after the character that is obsessed with the MC making for awkward moments, that I'm sure are supposed to be funny, but feel like they miss the mark by a lot.The show has a feeling somewhere between .hack//SIGN and Puella Magi Madoka Magica, and the story overall seems like it may trend toward the latter. I felt like I was reading chapters of a good book while watching this show, with each episode leaving me wanting to watch more, but also satisfied with each viewing block. only for it to be derailed rather suddenly.The story as a whole is a pretty slow burn, the few focus characters are revealed over the course of the show, rather than all at once and it's a nice change from the info dump episodes I'm used to getting these days. I felt like I was reading chapters of a good book while watching this show, with each episode leaving me wanting to watch more, but also satisfied with each viewing block.", 'In short this anime is like where the supposed MC comes from another world and is killed by the one girl who decides to help and that one girl is the MC .Then the FMC makes a yuri harem and kills Isekaied humans and pretends to be "pure", "just" and "Noble" which is pure bullsh** and she was just being a murderer who kills innocent people who is Isekaied from Japan . Just a pure garbage.The story is very predictable.The art style was very mid.The characters were too rushed with absolutely zero development.I can\'t believe anyone who is not a hardcore yuri addict...can like this series can like this series']

Name: Shin Koihime†Musou
Review: ['Finally a sequel to the first season of Koihime Musou. To be honest, I was expecting more from the second season but it turned out to be a below average show.Story:Here\'s the main issue about the second season. The story of this show is pretty low to none in my opinion. It\'s about a team of female warriors traveling through different kingdoms without any real objectives. In my opinion they did try to make some kind of story but it wasn\'t any good at all. They just kept traveling back and forth helping old friends with the weirdiest issues.Art:The art is just as the first...season. Nothing was really well drawn or crappy drawn. It\'s just your typical harem female warriors animation quality.Sound:Compared to the first season, the sound wasn\'t as good as the first season. The OP/ED song were decent. During the 12 episodes there were different songs being song, and a few of them were actually good in my opinion. I end up skipping the OP/ED on every episode.Character:Same as first season. There aren\'t any new main characters in season two. Nobody changed compared to the first season. All their personality remained the same.Enjoyment:I felt I didn\'t enjoyed the second season as much as the first season. The jokes weren\'t as good as the first season, and at some point you will get tired of the same echiness.Overall:If you want to kill some time or you\'re bored or a big fan of echi/comedy/random story anime, feel free to watch it, otherwise there are better animes out there to spend your time. I end up watching most of the episodes while chatting on msn/irc. The "score" 5 doesn\'t mean it\'s total crap, it means it\'s an average show with nothing really special. season. Nothing was really well drawn or crappy drawn. It\'s just your typical harem female warriors animation quality.Sound:Compared to the first season, the sound wasn\'t as good as the first season. The OP/ED song were decent. During the 12 episodes there were different songs being song, and a few of them were actually good in my opinion. I end up skipping the OP/ED on every episode.Character:Same as first season. There aren\'t any new main characters in season two. Nobody changed compared to the first season. All their personality remained the same.Enjoyment:I felt I didn\'t enjoyed the second season as much as the first season. The jokes weren\'t as good as the first season, and at some point you will get tired of the same echiness.Overall:If you want to kill some time or you\'re bored or a big fan of echi/comedy/random story anime, feel free to watch it, otherwise there are better animes out there to spend your time. I end up watching most of the episodes while chatting on msn/irc. The "score" 5 doesn\'t mean it\'s total crap, it means it\'s an average show with nothing really special.', "The sequel to the equally ecchi, cute and entertaining Koihime Musou. And just like it's predecessor, do not expect anything much from it's sequel.Story:The story picks up from where it left off last season with the gang on another journey full of eye-pleasing antics, random panty shots and ridiculous situations. And like the first season, each episode of Shin Koihime Musou presents a different tale in their journey in which the gang meet new friends and help them or meeting old friends and getting caught up in their desires. Needless to say there is no real plot; though they do attempt to create one.Art:Probably...not the best I've seen but it's certainly attention-grabbing. The character design is quite cute and is typical of an ecchi show. Each character is unique in the way that none of them share any common visual traits making each easily recognizable. The clothing design is simply great and again, each pair of clothing is unique from each other though all of them are equally skimpy and revealing; enough so that falling down causes a panty shot. The background is nothing special. Vibrant yes but simplistic.Sound:A new OP/ED which is neither good nor bad but is there for the sake of having it. There is a nice surprise in the show in the form of some singing sisters though they only do sing one or two songs but the last episode makes up for it. The BGM is average and sticks to the era they are in.Character:There are new characters for the audience to ogle while the old characters are brought back in with the same personality and random desires. The gang themselves do not change and with the addition of a new girl, they just get more eccentric. No development in the characters nor any major changes.Enjoyment:Like the first season, I enjoyed this show for what it is. I did not expect any plot or any depth but simply watched it for the fun and ecchi. The majority of the jokes had already been done and only a few really made me laugh. The ecchi gets repetitive and boring (if there was such a thing) but despite that I enjoyed it enough to make it through the entire season.Overall:A nice sequel to a show which stands on a foundation of ecchi and far-fetched situations and is certainly not one for those who don't like the idea of yuri ecchi. Ecchi fans will be delighted while ecchi haters will turn their heads in disgust. The 6 is an appropriate score to a show which has no plot and focuses on the interaction between the characters. not the best I've seen but it's certainly attention-grabbing. The 6 is an appropriate score to a show which has no plot and focuses on the interaction between the characters.", "This is a review for mostly, the entire Anime itself. As it said not to reveal spoilers, I will try my very best not to reveal any to you. :)Enjoyment - 10To be honest, I really don't know why it got such a low review. I actually stood up all night long watching this addicting Anime! Sure it has loads and LOADS of Yuri, but does that matter? No. What matters, is seeing the anime itself!Storyline - 4.9/5.I really think the storyline is quite detailed. As before, the Anime is based off of Romance of the Three Kingdoms, just with a Japanese twist, which is...fine. But there is a few things off. For example, The Wei and the Shu leaders, Sou Sou and Son Ken are apparently cool with eachother, and aren't at war... Aren't they supposed to be bitter enemies like in real history? And Sonsaku is supposed to be below Son Ken, not the other way around! Those two are the only things that bugged me. Other than that, I think the storyline is well put.Setting - 9.7/10.The Setting was so close to getting an amazing review, but, once again, there is improper things I find in here. For example, Chinese people NEVER did Game Shows, and this was what? Back in 176 or something? I don't remember, because I know Sou Sou was born in the same year as Cao Cao was, so I think it's around 176, 166, I could be wrong, but still. Anyhow, yeah, there is also Ninjas, JAPANESE letters on walls and stuff, and.... What? French Maid outfits? Ehh... No. There was no French maids, yet. So yeah, Setting gets 3 votes away from 5.Art - 10/10Art, I find very well put, and very touchy than other Animes. Very different too! Most of the scenes were beautiful, and I actually loved it! I don't really know what to say more, I just think the person who made this took their time!Sound - 5/10Sound was... meh... it didn't had enough emotion into it. I can barley hear it, and most of the dialogues were covering over it. I sure hope they release the music, so I can hear it better. The Main Theme though... The First was one of my FAVOURITES! The 2nd was..... meh... it was okay, I guess.Character(s) - 10.I LOVE the Characters! I think they were well developed and MUCH more better than regular history. For example, Cao Cao is a Tyrant and a really mean MEAN man, but Sou Sou, she is just pure win. I love Sou Sou, because, no, not because shes a Lesbian, because of her personality. Unlike Cao Cao, Sou Sou seems to be loved by her Soldiers, her guardians and even her Strategist. Okay, before I go fan boy here, on to the main protaganist, Kanu'u. Now, I don't blame Kau'u or Aisha getting complimented only for her black hair. Now, as being a Black Haired huntress, oh yes! I'd love going around with no armour killing off Bandits! Hmm... speaking of Bandits, I always remember those 3 Bandits! They are like Jesse, James and Meowth from Pokemon! So yeah, I have to give the characters props. Though... The Villains... This is probably the only thing I hate about this anime. The main villain, the guy who looks like Irie from Higurashi, just wasn't Villainous enough. I mean, we only see him once, and what does he do? Raise a giant army! Ooh! FUN! Now what does he do? Wait... that's it? That's ALL he can do? No magic? No Protaganists loosing? THAT'S IT? Wow, sucky villain! I don't like him! I mean, he turns the main villaness against him... and that's all the villains? We need more of them and Anti-heros!Overall - 10I love this Anime! It's one of my favourites! If they decide to remake it, atleast make the main villain so Evil, he'd be impossible to defeat for 6-7 seasons, or make more goons that are working for him or for themselves! I'd love to see Kau'u and Co. kick some ass! Oh, and give Sou Sou more screen time fighting... I only seen her use her weapon once! And it looks AWESOME! Atleast give her more time fighting than... hmmm.... giving fan service to her women?Anyways, that ends my review. This is my first review, and if there is anything wrong, tell me what to fix. Thank you!", "This being the sequel to Kouhime Musou, I will take both into account as it's one story.Throughout this series, you see a lot of history replicated, but instead of the men being a part of that, they're replaced by fan-serviced women, busty, colourful and appealing to the eye. Now lets move onto the review in full.Story: 5The story throughout this series has a good feel, when you read the synopsis of a series you decide whether to watch or not, the first season of Koihime Musou made me want to watch, like many others who carried onto the second season (or Third) although, it...didn't live up to expectations from the start. It has all its comedy points going for it, it's ecchi which is shown when you're watching and it's obviously in a fantasy world with magic and the 'war like' layout which is shown through the episodes when you see war-torn towns and cities and their rulers. This attempts to be historical, but it doesn't show much of Chinese history into good detail, maybe I'm going to far since 'Oda Nobuna' changed my view on Historical anime.Art: 7I found the art appealing and very well designed throughout, it was good work by Shinji Takasuga althouh it could of been better if he put the extra effort into it.Sound: 8I enjoyed all the songs in this series, they're plausible and almost anyone could enjoy them. They are very catchy and fun, I, myself think this is some of Akifumi Tada best work for music, as he placed a lot of songs into the series even though it was only 12 episodes.Character: 7The Character design was good work from Tomoya Hiratsuka, although this was such a typical ecchi design most people could of done it, although the character development was stop and go, you didn't see much from Bachou or Kanshou and they're supposed to be main characters. And then theirs Ryuubi, who you learn quite a lot about and gets a lot of screen-time even though she's the new character to the lot, she plays a key role in their journey this time round. The character development could of been better, although you can't please everyone.Enjoyment: 5I did enjoy the comedy and the fighting side of Shin Koihime†Musou, and I admit that Koihime Musou wasn't the type of anime you'd jump off your seat to watch, but it was very 'draggy', their is only 12 episodes but it felt like a lot more, it also took me a lot of time to finish Shin Koihime†Musou even though I enjoyed Koihime Musou a lot more than this sequel.Overall: 65+7+8+7+5 = 32/5 = 6.4That is how I figure out my overall ratings, not over personal preference if I didn't enjoy a show or not.I will watch the finale of this, Shin Koihime†Musou: Otome Tairan because I don't like to leave something unfinished once it's started. Hey, it's only 12 episodes, so about 4 hours. If I don't enjoy it, that's part of life.Thanks for reading. didn't live up to expectations from the start. Now, I don't blame Kau'u or Aisha getting complimented only for her black hair. Now, as being a Black Haired huntress, oh yes! I'd love going around with no armour killing off Bandits! Hmm... speaking of Bandits, I always remember those 3 Bandits! They are like Jesse, James and Meowth from Pokemon! So yeah, I have to give the characters props. Though... The Villains... This is probably the only thing I hate about this anime. The main villain, the guy who looks like Irie from Higurashi, just wasn't Villainous enough. I mean, we only see him once, and what does he do? Raise a giant army! Ooh! FUN! Now what does he do? Wait... that's it? That's ALL he can do? No magic? No Protaganists loosing? THAT'S IT? Wow, sucky villain! I don't like him! I mean, he turns the main villaness against him... and that's all the villains? We need more of them and Anti-heros!Overall - 10I love this Anime! It's one of my favourites! If they decide to remake it, atleast make the main villain so Evil, he'd be impossible to defeat for 6-7 seasons, or make more goons that are working for him or for themselves! I'd love to see Kau'u and Co. kick some ass! Oh, and give Sou Sou more screen time fighting... I only seen her use her weapon once! And it looks AWESOME! Atleast give her more time fighting than... hmmm.... giving fan service to her women?Anyways, that ends my review. This is my first review, and if there is anything wrong, tell me what to fix. Thank you!", "This being the sequel to Kouhime Musou, I will take both into account as it's one story.Throughout this series, you see a lot of history replicated, but instead of the men being a part of that, they're replaced by fan-serviced women, busty, colourful and appealing to the eye. Now lets move onto the review in full.Story: 5The story throughout this series has a good feel, when you read the synopsis of a series you decide whether to watch or not, the first season of Koihime Musou made me want to watch, like many others who carried onto the second season (or Third) although, it...didn't live up to expectations from the start. It has all its comedy points going for it, it's ecchi which is shown when you're watching and it's obviously in a fantasy world with magic and the 'war like' layout which is shown through the episodes when you see war-torn towns and cities and their rulers. This attempts to be historical, but it doesn't show much of Chinese history into good detail, maybe I'm going to far since 'Oda Nobuna' changed my view on Historical anime.Art: 7I found the art appealing and very well designed throughout, it was good work by Shinji Takasuga althouh it could of been better if he put the extra effort into it.Sound: 8I enjoyed all the songs in this series, they're plausible and almost anyone could enjoy them. They are very catchy and fun, I, myself think this is some of Akifumi Tada best work for music, as he placed a lot of songs into the series even though it was only 12 episodes.Character: 7The Character design was good work from Tomoya Hiratsuka, although this was such a typical ecchi design most people could of done it, although the character development was stop and go, you didn't see much from Bachou or Kanshou and they're supposed to be main characters. And then theirs Ryuubi, who you learn quite a lot about and gets a lot of screen-time even though she's the new character to the lot, she plays a key role in their journey this time round. The character development could of been better, although you can't please everyone.Enjoyment: 5I did enjoy the comedy and the fighting side of Shin Koihime†Musou, and I admit that Koihime Musou wasn't the type of anime you'd jump off your seat to watch, but it was very 'draggy', their is only 12 episodes but it felt like a lot more, it also took me a lot of time to finish Shin Koihime†Musou even though I enjoyed Koihime Musou a lot more than this sequel.Overall: 65+7+8+7+5 = 32/5 = 6.4That is how I figure out my overall ratings, not over personal preference if I didn't enjoy a show or not.I will watch the finale of this, Shin Koihime†Musou: Otome Tairan because I don't like to leave something unfinished once it's started. Hey, it's only 12 episodes, so about 4 hours. If I don't enjoy it, that's part of life.Thanks for reading. didn't live up to expectations from the start. To be honest, I was expecting more from the second season but it turned out to be a below average show.Story:Here\'s the main issue about the second season. The story of this show is pretty low to none in my opinion. It\'s about a team of female warriors traveling through different kingdoms without any real objectives. In my opinion they did try to make some kind of story but it wasn\'t any good at all. They just kept traveling back and forth helping old friends with the weirdiest issues.Art:The art is just as the first...season. Nothing was really well drawn or crappy drawn. It\'s just your typical harem female warriors animation quality.Sound:Compared to the first season, the sound wasn\'t as good as the first season. The OP/ED song were decent. During the 12 episodes there were different songs being song, and a few of them were actually good in my opinion. I end up skipping the OP/ED on every episode.Character:Same as first season. There aren\'t any new main characters in season two. Nobody changed compared to the first season. All their personality remained the same.Enjoyment:I felt I didn\'t enjoyed the second season as much as the first season. The jokes weren\'t as good as the first season, and at some point you will get tired of the same echiness.Overall:If you want to kill some time or you\'re bored or a big fan of echi/comedy/random story anime, feel free to watch it, otherwise there are better animes out there to spend your time. The "score" 5 doesn\'t mean it\'s total crap, it means it\'s an average show with nothing really special.', "The sequel to the equally ecchi, cute and entertaining Koihime Musou. And just like it's predecessor, do not expect anything much from it's sequel.Story:The story picks up from where it left off last season with the gang on another journey full of eye-pleasing antics, random panty shots and ridiculous situations. And like the first season, each episode of Shin Koihime Musou presents a different tale in their journey in which the gang meet new friends and help them or meeting old friends and getting caught up in their desires. Needless to say there is no real plot; though they do attempt to create one.Art:Probably...not the best I've seen but it's certainly attention-grabbing. The character design is quite cute and is typical of an ecchi show. Each character is unique in the way that none of them share any common visual traits making each easily recognizable. The clothing design is simply great and again, each pair of clothing is unique from each other though all of them are equally skimpy and revealing; enough so that falling down causes a panty shot. The background is nothing special. Vibrant yes but simplistic.Sound:A new OP/ED which is neither good nor bad but is there for the sake of having it. There is a nice surprise in the show in the form of some singing sisters though they only do sing one or two songs but the last episode makes up for it. The BGM is average and sticks to the era they are in.Character:There are new characters for the audience to ogle while the old characters are brought back in with the same personality and random desires. The gang themselves do not change and with the addition of a new girl, they just get more eccentric. No development in the characters nor any major changes.Enjoyment:Like the first season, I enjoyed this show for what it is. I did not expect any plot or any depth but simply watched it for the fun and ecchi. The majority of the jokes had already been done and only a few really made me laugh. The ecchi gets repetitive and boring (if there was such a thing) but despite that I enjoyed it enough to make it through the entire season.Overall:A nice sequel to a show which stands on a foundation of ecchi and far-fetched situations and is certainly not one for those who don't like the idea of yuri ecchi. Ecchi fans will be delighted while ecchi haters will turn their heads in disgust. The 6 is an appropriate score to a show which has no plot and focuses on the interaction between the characters. not the best I've seen but it's certainly attention-grabbing. The 6 is an appropriate score to a show which has no plot and focuses on the interaction between the characters.", "This is a review for mostly, the entire Anime itself. As it said not to reveal spoilers, I will try my very best not to reveal any to you. :)Enjoyment - 10To be honest, I really don't know why it got such a low review. I actually stood up all night long watching this addicting Anime! Sure it has loads and LOADS of Yuri, but does that matter? No. What matters, is seeing the anime itself!Storyline - 4.9/5.I really think the storyline is quite detailed. As before, the Anime is based off of Romance of the Three Kingdoms, just with a Japanese twist, which is...fine. But there is a few things off. For example, The Wei and the Shu leaders, Sou Sou and Son Ken are apparently cool with eachother, and aren't at war... Aren't they supposed to be bitter enemies like in real history? And Sonsaku is supposed to be below Son Ken, not the other way around! Those two are the only things that bugged me. Other than that, I think the storyline is well put.Setting - 9.7/10.The Setting was so close to getting an amazing review, but, once again, there is improper things I find in here. For example, Chinese people NEVER did Game Shows, and this was what? Back in 176 or something? I don't remember, because I know Sou Sou was born in the same year as Cao Cao was, so I think it's around 176, 166, I could be wrong, but still. Anyhow, yeah, there is also Ninjas, JAPANESE letters on walls and stuff, and.... What? French Maid outfits? Ehh... No. There was no French maids, yet. So yeah, Setting gets 3 votes away from 5.Art - 10/10Art, I find very well put, and very touchy than other Animes. Very different too! Most of the scenes were beautiful, and I actually loved it! I don't really know what to say more, I just think the person who made this took their time!Sound - 5/10Sound was... meh... it didn't had enough emotion into it. I can barley hear it, and most of the dialogues were covering over it. I sure hope they release the music, so I can hear it better. The Main Theme though... The First was one of my FAVOURITES! The 2nd was..... meh... it was okay, I guess.Character(s) - 10.I LOVE the Characters! I think they were well developed and MUCH more better than regular history. For example, Cao Cao is a Tyrant and a really mean MEAN man, but Sou Sou, she is just pure win. I love Sou Sou, because, no, not because shes a Lesbian, because of her personality. Unlike Cao Cao, Sou Sou seems to be loved by her Soldiers, her guardians and even her Strategist. Okay, before I go fan boy here, on to the main protaganist, Kanu'u. Now, I don't blame Kau'u or Aisha getting complimented only for her black hair. Now, as being a Black Haired huntress, oh yes! I'd love going around with no armour killing off Bandits! Hmm... speaking of Bandits, I always remember those 3 Bandits! They are like Jesse, James and Meowth from Pokemon! So yeah, I have to give the characters props. Though... The Villains... This is probably the only thing I hate about this anime. The main villain, the guy who looks like Irie from Higurashi, just wasn't Villainous enough. I mean, we only see him once, and what does he do? Raise a giant army! Ooh! FUN! Now what does he do? Wait... that's it? That's ALL he can do? No magic? No Protaganists loosing? THAT'S IT? Wow, sucky villain! I don't like him! I mean, he turns the main villaness against him... and that's all the villains? We need more of them and Anti-heros!Overall - 10I love this Anime! It's one of my favourites! If they decide to remake it, atleast make the main villain so Evil, he'd be impossible to defeat for 6-7 seasons, or make more goons that are working for him or for themselves! I'd love to see Kau'u and Co. kick some ass! Oh, and give Sou Sou more screen time fighting... I only seen her use her weapon once! And it looks AWESOME! Atleast give her more time fighting than... hmmm.... giving fan service to her women?Anyways, that ends my review. This is my first review, and if there is anything wrong, tell me what to fix. And just like it's predecessor, do not expect anything much from it's sequel.Story:The story picks up from where it left off last season with the gang on another journey full of eye-pleasing antics, random panty shots and ridiculous situations. And like the first season, each episode of Shin Koihime Musou presents a different tale in their journey in which the gang meet new friends and help them or meeting old friends and getting caught up in their desires. Needless to say there is no real plot; though they do attempt to create one.Art:Probably...not the best I've seen but it's certainly attention-grabbing. The character design is quite cute and is typical of an ecchi show. Each character is unique in the way that none of them share any common visual traits making each easily recognizable. The clothing design is simply great and again, each pair of clothing is unique from each other though all of them are equally skimpy and revealing; enough so that falling down causes a panty shot. The background is nothing special. Vibrant yes but simplistic.Sound:A new OP/ED which is neither good nor bad but is there for the sake of having it. There is a nice surprise in the show in the form of some singing sisters though they only do sing one or two songs but the last episode makes up for it. The BGM is average and sticks to the era they are in.Character:There are new characters for the audience to ogle while the old characters are brought back in with the same personality and random desires. The gang themselves do not change and with the addition of a new girl, they just get more eccentric. No development in the characters nor any major changes.Enjoyment:Like the first season, I enjoyed this show for what it is. I did not expect any plot or any depth but simply watched it for the fun and ecchi. The majority of the jokes had already been done and only a few really made me laugh. The ecchi gets repetitive and boring (if there was such a thing) but despite that I enjoyed it enough to make it through the entire season.Overall:A nice sequel to a show which stands on a foundation of ecchi and far-fetched situations and is certainly not one for those who don't like the idea of yuri ecchi. Ecchi fans will be delighted while ecchi haters will turn their heads in disgust. The 6 is an appropriate score to a show which has no plot and focuses on the interaction between the characters. not the best I've seen but it's certainly attention-grabbing. The 6 is an appropriate score to a show which has no plot and focuses on the interaction between the characters.", "This is a review for mostly, the entire Anime itself. As it said not to reveal spoilers, I will try my very best not to reveal any to you. :)Enjoyment - 10To be honest, I really don't know why it got such a low review. I actually stood up all night long watching this addicting Anime! Sure it has loads and LOADS of Yuri, but does that matter? No. What matters, is seeing the anime itself!Storyline - 4.9/5.I really think the storyline is quite detailed. As before, the Anime is based off of Romance of the Three Kingdoms, just with a Japanese twist, which is...fine. But there is a few things off. For example, The Wei and the Shu leaders, Sou Sou and Son Ken are apparently cool with eachother, and aren't at war... Aren't they supposed to be bitter enemies like in real history? And Sonsaku is supposed to be below Son Ken, not the other way around! Those two are the only things that bugged me. Other than that, I think the storyline is well put.Setting - 9.7/10.The Setting was so close to getting an amazing review, but, once again, there is improper things I find in here. For example, Chinese people NEVER did Game Shows, and this was what? Back in 176 or something? I don't remember, because I know Sou Sou was born in the same year as Cao Cao was, so I think it's around 176, 166, I could be wrong, but still. Anyhow, yeah, there is also Ninjas, JAPANESE letters on walls and stuff, and.... What? French Maid outfits? Ehh... No. There was no French maids, yet. So yeah, Setting gets 3 votes away from 5.Art - 10/10Art, I find very well put, and very touchy than other Animes. Very different too! Most of the scenes were beautiful, and I actually loved it! I don't really know what to say more, I just think the person who made this took their time!Sound - 5/10Sound was... meh... it didn't had enough emotion into it. I can barley hear it, and most of the dialogues were covering over it. I sure hope they release the music, so I can hear it better. The Main Theme though... The First was one of my FAVOURITES! The 2nd was..... meh... it was okay, I guess.Character(s) - 10.I LOVE the Characters! I think they were well developed and MUCH more better than regular history. For example, Cao Cao is a Tyrant and a really mean MEAN man, but Sou Sou, she is just pure win. I love Sou Sou, because, no, not because shes a Lesbian, because of her personality. Unlike Cao Cao, Sou Sou seems to be loved by her Soldiers, her guardians and even her Strategist. Okay, before I go fan boy here, on to the main protaganist, Kanu'u. Now, I don't blame Kau'u or Aisha getting complimented only for her black hair. Now, as being a Black Haired huntress, oh yes! I'd love going around with no armour killing off Bandits! Hmm... speaking of Bandits, I always remember those 3 Bandits! They are like Jesse, James and Meowth from Pokemon! So yeah, I have to give the characters props. Though... The Villains... This is probably the only thing I hate about this anime. The main villain, the guy who looks like Irie from Higurashi, just wasn't Villainous enough. I mean, we only see him once, and what does he do? Raise a giant army! Ooh! FUN! Now what does he do? Wait... that's it? That's ALL he can do? No magic? No Protaganists loosing? THAT'S IT? Wow, sucky villain! I don't like him! I mean, he turns the main villaness against him... and that's all the villains? We need more of them and Anti-heros!Overall - 10I love this Anime! It's one of my favourites! If they decide to remake it, atleast make the main villain so Evil, he'd be impossible to defeat for 6-7 seasons, or make more goons that are working for him or for themselves! I'd love to see Kau'u and Co. kick some ass! Oh, and give Sou Sou more screen time fighting... I only seen her use her weapon once! And it looks AWESOME! Atleast give her more time fighting than... hmmm.... giving fan service to her women?Anyways, that ends my review. This is my first review, and if there is anything wrong, tell me what to fix. Thank you!", "This being the sequel to Kouhime Musou, I will take both into account as it's one story.Throughout this series, you see a lot of history replicated, but instead of the men being a part of that, they're replaced by fan-serviced women, busty, colourful and appealing to the eye. Now lets move onto the review in full.Story: 5The story throughout this series has a good feel, when you read the synopsis of a series you decide whether to watch or not, the first season of Koihime Musou made me want to watch, like many others who carried onto the second season (or Third) although, it...didn't live up to expectations from the start. It has all its comedy points going for it, it's ecchi which is shown when you're watching and it's obviously in a fantasy world with magic and the 'war like' layout which is shown through the episodes when you see war-torn towns and cities and their rulers. This attempts to be historical, but it doesn't show much of Chinese history into good detail, maybe I'm going to far since 'Oda Nobuna' changed my view on Historical anime.Art: 7I found the art appealing and very well designed throughout, it was good work by Shinji Takasuga althouh it could of been better if he put the extra effort into it.Sound: 8I enjoyed all the songs in this series, they're plausible and almost anyone could enjoy them. They are very catchy and fun, I, myself think this is some of Akifumi Tada best work for music, as he placed a lot of songs into the series even though it was only 12 episodes.Character: 7The Character design was good work from Tomoya Hiratsuka, although this was such a typical ecchi design most people could of done it, although the character development was stop and go, you didn't see much from Bachou or Kanshou and they're supposed to be main characters. And then theirs Ryuubi, who you learn quite a lot about and gets a lot of screen-time even though she's the new character to the lot, she plays a key role in their journey this time round. The character development could of been better, although you can't please everyone.Enjoyment: 5I did enjoy the comedy and the fighting side of Shin Koihime†Musou, and I admit that Koihime Musou wasn't the type of anime you'd jump off your seat to watch, but it was very 'draggy', their is only 12 episodes but it felt like a lot more, it also took me a lot of time to finish Shin Koihime†Musou even though I enjoyed Koihime Musou a lot more than this sequel.Overall: 65+7+8+7+5 = 32/5 = 6.4That is how I figure out my overall ratings, not over personal preference if I didn't enjoy a show or not.I will watch the finale of this, Shin Koihime†Musou: Otome Tairan because I don't like to leave something unfinished once it's started. Hey, it's only 12 episodes, so about 4 hours. If I don't enjoy it, that's part of life.Thanks for reading. didn't live up to expectations from the start. In my opinion they did try to make some kind of story but it wasn\'t any good at all. They just kept traveling back and forth helping old friends with the weirdiest issues.Art:The art is just as the first...season. Nothing was really well drawn or crappy drawn. There aren\'t any new main characters in season two. Nobody changed compared to the first season. I mean, we only see him once, and what does he do? Raise a giant army! Ooh! FUN! Now what does he do? Wait... that's it? That's ALL he can do? No magic? No Protaganists loosing? THAT'S IT? Wow, sucky villain! I don't like him! I mean, he turns the main villaness against him... and that's all the villains? We need more of them and Anti-heros!Overall - 10I love this Anime! It's one of my favourites! If they decide to remake it, atleast make the main villain so Evil, he'd be impossible to defeat for 6-7 seasons, or make more goons that are working for him or for themselves! I'd love to see Kau'u and Co. kick some ass! Oh, and give Sou Sou more screen time fighting... I only seen her use her weapon once! And it looks AWESOME! Atleast give her more time fighting than... hmmm.... giving fan service to her women?Anyways, that ends my review. This is my first review, and if there is anything wrong, tell me what to fix. Thank you!", "This being the sequel to Kouhime Musou, I will take both into account as it's one story.Throughout this series, you see a lot of history replicated, but instead of the men being a part of that, they're replaced by fan-serviced women, busty, colourful and appealing to the eye. Now lets move onto the review in full.Story: 5The story throughout this series has a good feel, when you read the synopsis of a series you decide whether to watch or not, the first season of Koihime Musou made me want to watch, like many others who carried onto the second season (or Third) although, it...didn't live up to expectations from the start. It has all its comedy points going for it, it's ecchi which is shown when you're watching and it's obviously in a fantasy world with magic and the 'war like' layout which is shown through the episodes when you see war-torn towns and cities and their rulers. This attempts to be historical, but it doesn't show much of Chinese history into good detail, maybe I'm going to far since 'Oda Nobuna' changed my view on Historical anime.Art: 7I found the art appealing and very well designed throughout, it was good work by Shinji Takasuga althouh it could of been better if he put the extra effort into it.Sound: 8I enjoyed all the songs in this series, they're plausible and almost anyone could enjoy them. They are very catchy and fun, I, myself think this is some of Akifumi Tada best work for music, as he placed a lot of songs into the series even though it was only 12 episodes.Character: 7The Character design was good work from Tomoya Hiratsuka, although this was such a typical ecchi design most people could of done it, although the character development was stop and go, you didn't see much from Bachou or Kanshou and they're supposed to be main characters. And then theirs Ryuubi, who you learn quite a lot about and gets a lot of screen-time even though she's the new character to the lot, she plays a key role in their journey this time round. The character development could of been better, although you can't please everyone.Enjoyment: 5I did enjoy the comedy and the fighting side of Shin Koihime†Musou, and I admit that Koihime Musou wasn't the type of anime you'd jump off your seat to watch, but it was very 'draggy', their is only 12 episodes but it felt like a lot more, it also took me a lot of time to finish Shin Koihime†Musou even though I enjoyed Koihime Musou a lot more than this sequel.Overall: 65+7+8+7+5 = 32/5 = 6.4That is how I figure out my overall ratings, not over personal preference if I didn't enjoy a show or not.I will watch the finale of this, Shin Koihime†Musou: Otome Tairan because I don't like to leave something unfinished once it's started. Hey, it's only 12 episodes, so about 4 hours. If I don't enjoy it, that's part of life.Thanks for reading. didn't live up to expectations from the start. Hey, it's only 12 episodes, so about 4 hours. If I don't enjoy it, that's part of life.Thanks for reading.", 'I said I stopped watching the Koihime Musou series after the first season\'s OVA. AND. It kinda dissapointed :( ', 'Finally a sequel to the first season of Koihime Musou. To be honest, I was expecting more from the second season but it turned out to be a below average show.Story:Here\'s the main issue about the second season. The story of this show is pretty low to none in my opinion. It\'s about a team of female warriors traveling through different kingdoms without any real objectives. In my opinion they did try to make some kind of story but it wasn\'t any good at all. They just kept traveling back and forth helping old friends with the weirdiest issues.Art:The art is just as the first...season. Nothing was really well drawn or crappy drawn. It\'s just your typical harem female warriors animation quality.Sound:Compared to the first season, the sound wasn\'t as good as the first season. The OP/ED song were decent. During the 12 episodes there were different songs being song, and a few of them were actually good in my opinion. I end up skipping the OP/ED on every episode.Character:Same as first season. There aren\'t any new main characters in season two. Nobody changed compared to the first season. All their personality remained the same.Enjoyment:I felt I didn\'t enjoyed the second season as much as the first season. The jokes weren\'t as good as the first season, and at some point you will get tired of the same echiness.Overall:If you want to kill some time or you\'re bored or a big fan of echi/comedy/random story anime, feel free to watch it, otherwise there are better animes out there to spend your time. The "score" 5 doesn\'t mean it\'s total crap, it means it\'s an average show with nothing really special.', "The sequel to the equally ecchi, cute and entertaining Koihime Musou. And just like it's predecessor, do not expect anything much from it's sequel.Story:The story picks up from where it left off last season with the gang on another journey full of eye-pleasing antics, random panty shots and ridiculous situations. And like the first season, each episode of Shin Koihime Musou presents a different tale in their journey in which the gang meet new friends and help them or meeting old friends and getting caught up in their desires. Needless to say there is no real plot; though they do attempt to create one.Art:Probably...not the best I've seen but it's certainly attention-grabbing. The character design is quite cute and is typical of an ecchi show. Each character is unique in the way that none of them share any common visual traits making each easily recognizable. The clothing design is simply great and again, each pair of clothing is unique from each other though all of them are equally skimpy and revealing; enough so that falling down causes a panty shot. The background is nothing special. Vibrant yes but simplistic.Sound:A new OP/ED which is neither good nor bad but is there for the sake of having it. There is a nice surprise in the show in the form of some singing sisters though they only do sing one or two songs but the last episode makes up for it. The BGM is average and sticks to the era they are in.Character:There are new characters for the audience to ogle while the old characters are brought back in with the same personality and random desires. The gang themselves do not change and with the addition of a new girl, they just get more eccentric. No development in the characters nor any major changes.Enjoyment:Like the first season, I enjoyed this show for what it is. I did not expect any plot or any depth but simply watched it for the fun and ecchi. The majority of the jokes had already been done and only a few really made me laugh. The ecchi gets repetitive and boring (if there was such a thing) but despite that I enjoyed it enough to make it through the entire season.Overall:A nice sequel to a show which stands on a foundation of ecchi and far-fetched situations and is certainly not one for those who don't like the idea of yuri ecchi. Ecchi fans will be delighted while ecchi haters will turn their heads in disgust. The 6 is an appropriate score to a show which has no plot and focuses on the interaction between the characters. not the best I've seen but it's certainly attention-grabbing.
